page.title: 11SEWAGE WORKS
page.content: SEWAGE WORKS. WE VISITED WILLINGTON SEWAGE TREARMENT WORKS. IT WAS BUILT IN 1966 TO SERVE WILLINGTON AND COPLE.THE BROWNISH GREY SEWAGE WATER IS CLEANED SO THAT IT CAN GO INTO THE RIVER. THERE IS A BIG RAKE WHICH SCRAPES LARGE RUBBISH OFF A GRID, THEN THE LIQUID GOES TO A SETTLING TANK WHERE THE RUBBISH AT THE BOTTOM CAN BE REMOVED. THIS IS TAKEN TO THE BIG SEWAGE WORKS IN BEDFORD,TREATED AGAIN, THEN USED AS FERTILISER BY THE FARMERS. THE NEXT STAGE IS THE AERATION TANK WHEN AIR IS PUMPED INTO A TANK AND MICROBES HELP KILL GERMS.NEXT THE SEWAGE LEFT SETTLES AND THE CLEANER WATER GOES INTO THE RIVER THROUGH A PIPE.LATER IT IS TREATED AGAIN AT THE WATER WORKS SO WE CAN DRINK IT.
